content:
Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: The account you're trying to delete is Local Folders, which somehow was renamed to dd. It isn't like a mail account that can be deleted, so I suggest you rename it to Local Folders.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Is this a recent problem? That is, did you receive mail previously on this account on the PC? Do you receive mail on the PC when the phone is turned off? There are two possibilities; one is that the settings on PC are wrong, causing you to not receive mail. The other option is that the phone is set for POP and retrieves messages and deletes from server. You can verify which it is by these steps: - turn phone off - from online account, send yourself an email - see if you receive it on PC - after checking that, turn phone on and check mail there

If you received it on PC, then the phone is the problem. If not, then the PC settings are wrong. Please post complete error message and screenshot of incoming server settings pane and someone here may have suggestions. Thank you
creator: davidsk

content:
I have discovered the problem with my 2nd item issue: CAPITAL LETTERS. In the past I would use capital letters in the email address if it contained the name the name of the addressee (Title Case). It had no effect on it being sent or the listing. It still is sent w/o a problem, but THUNDERBIRD doesn't recognize CAPITAL LETTERS as being in the address book. Thus, it's NOT in the address book even though it is.

I will be changing all of them to LC as I discover them.

Still working on issue #1 which is truly bothersome and can be DISASTROUS.

content: That should not be a problem. Having written that, I always recommend doing backups for upgrades, just to avoid gremlins. So, prior to the upgrade, I suggest you exit thunderbird and do backup of the profile. THEN, I suggest uninstalling the 32-bit version (do NOT check the option to 'remove data') and then install the 64-bit version. The profile should remain intact.
creator: davidsk
